abstract: Jenna Wortham and Sam Grobart discuss technology, social networking and journalism with The Times’s Google+ community in their first video hangout.
snippet: Jenna Wortham and Sam Grobart discuss technology, social networking and journalism with The Times’s Google+ community in their first video hangout.
lead_paragraph: Jenna Wortham and Sam Grobart discuss technology, social networking and journalism with The Times’s Google+ community in their first video hangout.

abstract: Sam Grobart, personal technology editor at The Times, and Jenna Wortham, a technology reporter, invited readers to join them for a public group videochat. Watch a recording of the session and let us know what you think about this use of the technology.
snippet: Sam Grobart, personal technology editor at The Times, and Jenna Wortham, a technology reporter, invited readers to join them for a public group videochat. Watch a recording of the session and let us know what you think about this use of the techno...
lead_paragraph: Sam Grobart and I participated in a public experiment on Wednesday afternoon: We invited readers who use Google+ to join us in a videochatting session using Google Hangouts, to talk about all things tech.

headline.main: A Bits Experiment on Google Hangouts

abstract: Martha Stewart’s live Thanksgiving show featured a bevy of interactive and real-time technologies, including questions via Twitter, Facebook and even Google’s new social network, Google+. Ms. Stewart said that this year, more than 8,000 questions came in from the Internet.
snippet: Martha Stewart’s live Thanksgiving show featured a bevy of interactive and real-time technologies, including questions via Twitter, Facebook and even Google’s new social network, Google+. Ms. Stewart said that this year, more than 8,000 questions ...
lead_paragraph: Martha Stewart isn’t just a whiz in the kitchen. She’s also a mistress of social media.

headline.main: Martha Stewart Goes Social With Her Turkey Hot Line

abstract: In this week’s Tech Talk podcast, Tanzina Vega, the Times reporter covering digital advertising, explains how BrightTag’s One Click Privacy works for Web surfers. Phil Simon discusses his new book, “The Age of the Platform: How Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google Have Redefined Business.”
snippet: In this week’s Tech Talk podcast, Tanzina Vega, the Times reporter covering digital advertising, explains how BrightTag’s One Click Privacy works for Web surfers. Phil Simon discusses his new book, “The Age of the Platform: How Amazon, Apple, Face...
lead_paragraph: As the World Wide Web Consortium and the Federal Trade Commission work to create a Do Not Track standard for consumers’ online privacy, some companies are trying out their own methods to give Web surfers more control over what personal data sites can collect. Tanzina Vega, a reporter on the Times media desk, explains how BrightTag’s new One Click Privacy button works.

headline.main: Tech Talk Podcast: Great Big Privacy Buttons
